member.summary: Container for the parameters to the AssociateDeviceWithPlacement operation. Associates a physical device with a placement.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.AssociateDeviceWithPlacementRequest.DeviceId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeviceId.
The ID of the physical device to be associated with the given placement in the project. Note that a mandatory 4 character prefix is required for all deviceId values.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.AssociateDeviceWithPlacementRequest.DeviceTemplateName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeviceTemplateName.

member.summary:

The name of the placement in which to associate the device.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.AssociateDeviceWithPlacementRequest.ProjectName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectName.
The name of the project containing the placement in which to associate the device.

member.summary: This is the response object from the CreatePlacement operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.CreateProjectRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateProject operation. Creates an empty project with a placement template. A project contains zero or more placements that adhere to the placement template defined in the project.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
An optional description for the project.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.CreateProjectRequest.PlacementTemplate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PlacementTemplate.
The schema defining the placement to be created. A placement template defines placement default attributes and device templates. You cannot add or remove device templates after the project has been created. However, you can update callbackOverrides for the device templates using the UpdateProject API.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.CreateProjectRequest.ProjectName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProjectName.
The name of the project to create.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.CreateProjectRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Optional tags (metadata key/value pairs) to be associated with the project. For example, { {"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2"} }. For more information, see AWS Tagging Strategies.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.CreateProjectResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateProject operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.DeletePlacementRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeletePlacement operation. Deletes a placement. To delete a placement, it must not have any devices associated with it.
When you delete a placement, all associated data becomes irretrievable.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.DeletePlacementRequest.PlacementName
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.DeletePlacementRequest.ProjectName
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.DeletePlacementResponse

member.name: T:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.DeleteProjectRequest

member.name: T:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.UpdateProjectRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateProject operation. Updates a project associated with your AWS account and region. With the exception of device template names, you can pass just the values that need to be updated because the update request will change only the values that are provided. To clear a value, pass the empty string (i.e., "").

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.IoT1ClickProjects.Model.UpdateProjectRequest.PlacementTemplate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PlacementTemplate.
An object defining the project update. Once a project has been created, you cannot add device template names to the project. However, for a given placementTemplate, you can update the associated callbackOverrides for the device definition using this API.

member.summary:

The name of the project to be updated.
